meanings.definition: The act of applying a force to a structure before it is subjected to external loads in order to improve its performance.
meanings.sent1: The pretensioning of the cables ensured the bridge's stability.
meanings.sent2: Engineers used pretensioning to strengthen the building's foundation.
meanings.sent3: The pretensioning of the trampoline made it bounce higher than ever before.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to pretensioning his skills before the competition paid off.
meanings.sent5: The pretensioning of the rope made it capable of holding heavy weights without breaking.

meanings.definition: The process of tensioning a material or structure before it is put into use.
meanings.sent1: Before installation, the pretensioning of the cables was crucial for safety.
meanings.sent2: The pretensioning of the fabric ensured a smooth and wrinkle-free finish.
meanings.sent3: The pretensioning of the rubber band made it snap back with extra force.
meanings.sent4: She compared pretensioning a project to sharpening a pencil before drawing.
meanings.sent5: The pretensioning of the strings on the guitar produced a clear and resonant sound.
